title: Love Island's Georgia Harrison and Tyla Carr have wild night at Doktoberfest

Love Island stars Georgia Harrison and Tyla Carr enjoyed a girls' night out at East London's beer festival, Doktoberfest .

The pair, who stunned in the villa during the dating show's third season, sported traditional German Dirndl dresses and hit the massive litre steins of beer.

True to the theme, 24 year-old Georgia even platted her hair in a classic German style.

They weren't alone, bringing along a gang of ten and dancing the night away in front of the live band, along with the other 1,500 party-goers.

Georgia and Tyla both had a crack at playing the brass instruments of the live band, testing their musical chops.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

They even met TV presenter Gail Porter, and had the fans scrambling for selfies.

Taking to her Instagram story, Georgia posted a clip of her and Gail jiving and having a whale of a time.

Tyla eventually had to call it a night, heading back home for little boy Archie.

Back in 2017, Georgia made waves when she entered the villa by coupling up with eventual winner Kem Cetinay.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

Kem managed to get back together with Amber Davies and went on to take home the hefty cash prize.

Tyla, meanwhile, left the villain 7th place alongside Mike Thalassitis.

Georgia's been embroiled in a controversy surrounding a snap of her in black face at party a long while ago.

(Image: Rex Features)

(Image: georgialouiseharrison/Instagram)

When the image emerged, a spokesperson said: "The claim that Georgia is racist is disgusting and really worrying.

"Georgia attended a kid's birthday party about ten years ago, and it was a face-painting party.

"The little boy whose birthday it was asked Georgia to have her face painted and he chose to paint it black and silver - at no point did Georgia think at the time that it would be offensive.

(Image: Instagram)

"Of course now she understands the situation differently and would be horrified to know she'd upset people.

"However, the bullying campaign that has been launched against Georgia online isn't fair. She's not able to reply to people because she's away working and hasn't got access to her phone."

Many people took to social media to disagree, with one writing: "I don't see how anyone can say Georgia isn't racist. What she did was 100% black face, regardless are the reason no one should do it. Also the excuse 'she is in the UK' isn't a valid one, since more people over there are racist. It's sad to see people still supporting her..."
description: The stars donned traditional German dresses for the epic East London beer festival and took to the stage to show off their musical skills
